page.title: 10EDUCATION IN BASSINGBOURN
page.content: Most children go to playgroup when they are 3 years old. At 4 they go to primary school, at 11 to the Village College. At 16 they go to work or to a sixth form college in Cambridge. In July all children meet their new teachers for September. The College takes children from different primary schools so this is their first meeting except on area sports days. They may meet again at holiday summer school. The Village College in South End is a community centre as well as a school for 600 pupils. It has a playgroup, youth and adult clubs, evening classes and even its own farm. It was opened by the Rt. Hon. R.A.Butler in 1954. The primary school has two buildings: infants (built 1877) in High Street; juniors (built 1963) in Brook Road. It has about 150 infants, 200 juniors. Another playgroup is at the Barracks.
